item.title: In this Supreme Court case, a sledgehammer is better than a scalpel
item.description: On Trump’s ability to fire the heads of agencies, the Supreme Court should take the harder route.

item.title: Courage and cowardice in Bondi Beach
item.description: An antisemitic attack in Australia shows the scourge of antisemitism is global.

item.title: This alliance has become transactional. Here’s how to repair it.
item.description: As the transatlantic alliance shifts, Trump’s tough love is no reason to get in bed with China.

item.title: Cracking down on citizenship ceremonies sends the wrong message
item.description: Trump unfairly levels collective punishment against people legally in the U.S. from 19 countries.

item.title: The lunacy of asking tourists to turn over their social media history
item.description: America’s closest allies are among the 42 countries in the visa waiver program targeted by Trump.

item.title: A reminder of Iran’s continuing brutality
item.description: The regime arrested a Nobel Peace Prize winner at a Friday funeral for another human rights activist.

item.title: As a conservative, I’m beginning to wonder: Are we the bad guys?
item.description: Republican bigotry, tariffs and defense spending, through readers’ eyes.

item.title: Australia acts to protect children online. Where’s America?
item.description: Congress must act quickly to save children from addictive, predatory social media.

item.title: The special pleasure — and pain — of living in the suburbs
item.description: Suburban life and cannibalistic death, through readers’ eyes.

item.title: AI regulation is properly a national issue
item.description: But Trump’s executive order to bully states is the wrong way to act.

item.title: Why does anyone want to buy Warner Brothers, anyway?
item.description: The company’s history of failed mergers and acquisitions is not stopping its latest suitors.

item.title: Hooray for Hoosiers, cynical GOP redistricting fails
item.description: Despite a White House intimidation, Indiana legislators defeated an unfair gerrymandering ploy.
